title: Edit calendar event status
content: Events created in Outlook can be marked as tentative. When I open these in Thunderbird I see a line "Status: Tentative". However when editing the event this field disappears and I don't see any way to edit the status. Is there a workaround for this?

title: Including Thunderbird to Apple Calendar with Google Mail Account - NO iCloud
content:
Hello together, I'am trying to integrate Thunderbird to my iMac Calendar - so synchronise a necessary Google Calendar into my iMac Calendar. Yes, this is "normally" direct possible - but no with Mac OS 10.13.6 So, I create my Thunderbird Account - everything is working, changed the Account to SSL/TLs and OAuth2.

Now, when I'am trying to make a new Account in my iMac Calendar - Accounts - "+" - Mail Account and set all necessary details - I'am getting always the same error, even on an iMac with Mac OS 10.15.7 (see picture).

Has someone an idea!?

Many thanks and best Regards from Germany Gordon
creator: gordon1322

creator: margerywardnorth

title: The article "How to create and use mailing lists on Thunderbird" doesn't work on version 102.12.0 (64-bit)
content:
I can no longer use Contact Lists to send emails as I used to be able to do. [I'm using a PC running Windows 11 Home and Thunderbird 102.12.0 (64-bit).) The article https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-create-and-use-mailing-lists-thu... relates to version 102 & Windows 8 - and used to work for me. "Create a mailing list - Option 2:" doesn't work for selecting more than one entry. I can drag a single entry to the new Contact List but have to be careful about clicking on it or else the entry opens for editing.

"Create email using a mailing list - Via the Address Book" no longer works: - On the Mail Toolbar, locate 'Address Book'. [OK] - Click Address Book to open it. [OK] - Select the mailing list. [OK] - Click the Write button. [BUT there is no Write button; the only options above the addresses are New Address Book | New Contact | New List | Import] [I tried right-clicking on the Contact List that I want to use but the only options are Properties | Print... | Export... | Delete and Default start-up directory] "Create email using a mailing list - Via a new Write message" does seem to work - but as the article says, "You cannot see individual contacts. This saves you from needing to change eg. To to Bcc, but you cannot edit any names from that email using this method."
creator: EmmBee

title: Default account to send with
content: Thought I posted this, but can't find it.... How do I set a default account to send with, UNLESS I specifically choose a different one? ie whenever I click "Write", I want it to use the same account every time, unless I manually choose a different one... Thought it always did this, but have sent a few emails recently, and they seem to have defaulted to the "last used" address. Thanks.
creator: hornetster

title: Can't Send Email Suddenly
content:
All of a sudden, after years of everything working, I can no longer send emails from Thunderbird. I called my internet/email provider and they did all kinds of stuff to check if it was their problem and ruled things out and said it must be Thunderbird. All of the email settings are correct. I tried turning off my Norton from scanning outgoing email. I'm stumped. Outgoing server mail.twc.com Port 587. Normal Password. SSL/TLS. When I try to send, it tries for awhile and then times out and says it can't connect to server.

I get incoming emails fine and all of my internet surfing works fine. Started suddenly about a week ago. Thanks.
creator: khq0660

title: Thunderbird is not pulling down emails that the Email host has flagged as Junk
content:
I have just found out that Thunderbird is not pulling down emails that the Email host has flagged as Junk and put in the Junk folder. Some of these emails are legitimate emails, not Junk.

Or to put it another way.

If I log into my email host provider webmail interface I can see thousands of emails in the junk folder that Thunderbird has not pulled down.

My email hosting company tells me there is a way to make thunderbird sync with all folders including the junk folder - to ensure I get all emails including Junk. Is this right? If so how do I do that?
creator: David724

content:
